original: tsa yig dbyangs kyi don no //
analyzed: tsa yig dbyangs kyi don no //
translated: The letter ca is the meaning of the vowel.

original: ka ma tha: b'a ma na: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: ka ma tha: b'a ma na: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no //
translated: Kamaṭha, vāmana, anubhāṣita, and so on, as before.

original: kantha: gr'i b'a:...(mgrin pa/) kr'i: brinya dag las aa nuna'o //
analyzed: kantha: gr'i b'a:...(mgrin pa/) kr'i: brinya dag las aa nuna'o //
translated: Kaṇṭha, garī, and so on, from the two, briñ, and so on, anu.

original: kr'i rnam par g-yeng ba la'o //
analyzed: kr'i rnam par g-yeng ba la'o //
translated: Kaṭi is distraction.

original: brinya sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: brinya sgrib pa la'o //
translated: Briñ is obscuration.

original: 'di dag las aa nun 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las aa nun 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, anu is the transformation.

original: na yig dbyangs don /
analyzed: na yig dbyangs don /
translated: The letter na is the meaning of the vowel.

original: ai ka'i aata aeng zhes pas aa nyid do //
analyzed: ai ka'i aata aeng zhes pas aa nyid do //
translated: From ika's aṅ, it is a itself.

original: ri ka'i aan las ra la dag go zhes pas ra pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: ri ka'i aan las ra la dag go zhes pas ra pha rol nyid do //
translated: From rika's aṅ, ra and la, it is ra, the other side.

original: ka ra nu: (gsang gnas/)...gu hya: sth'a nam ba ru na mu kha ro ma:...(kha sbu/) aurnnu las da'o //
analyzed: ka ra nu: (gsang gnas/)...gu hya: sth'a nam ba ru na mu kha ro ma:...(kha sbu/) aurnnu las da'o //
translated: Karṇu, guhya, sthāna, varuṇamukharomam, from ūrṇu.

original: aurnnu 'gebs pa la'o //
analyzed: aurnnu 'gebs pa la'o //
translated: Ūrṇu is covering.

original: 'di las da pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las da pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From this, da is the other side.

original: da yig mtha'i aats sogs dbyi'o //
analyzed: da yig mtha'i aats sogs dbyi'o //
translated: The letter da is the meaning of the final aṅ and so on.

original: d'apra: a'urnnu me sha ro ma: nya ma mtha' las da'o //
analyzed: d'apra: a'urnnu me sha ro ma: nya ma mtha' las da'o //
translated: Dāpra, ūrṇum, eśa romā, from nyā, the end.

original: nya ma zhes pa so sor bsdu ba bzung ba'o //
analyzed: nya ma zhes pa so sor bsdu ba bzung ba'o //
translated: Nyā is the individual collection.

original: nya ma nga na nam\ nya ma mtha' ni gang gi bya ba'i don las de'i 'di nya ma mtha'o //
analyzed: nya ma nga na nam\ nya ma mtha' ni gang gi bya ba'i don las de'i 'di nya ma mtha'o //
translated: The suffix nya is used to indicate I am sick, the end of the students, and the end of the students' activities.

original: de la tsa mu tstsha mu dza mu dzha mu za ba la'o //
analyzed: de la tsa mu tstsha mu dza mu dzha mu za ba la'o //
translated: In that [verse], tsami tsami is used for fish, tsami tsami for mouth, tsami tsami for water, and tsami tsami for to eat.

original: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
translated: Shami shami is used for to pacify,

original: aa na ra na b'a na bh'u na zhes pa danda ka'i byings /
analyzed: aa na ra na b'a na bh'u na zhes pa danda ka'i byings /
translated: anaranavānavāṇa is a group of dandhas,

original: gamli sri pli 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: gamli sri pli 'gro ba la'o //
translated: gamli plili is used for to go,

original: kha nu ngas par 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: kha nu ngas par 'joms pa la'o //
translated: khanu is used for to destroy,

original: nya ma mtha' 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams las da pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nya ma mtha' 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams las da pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and nya is used for the end of words such as like this.

original: da yig thos par byed pa'i don no //
analyzed: da yig thos par byed pa'i don no //
translated: The syllable da is for the meaning of to hear,

original: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no /
analyzed: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no /
translated: and the suffix nya is as before.

original: (/ khro mo/)...tsanda:...(gtum mo/) durdzdza na ...(skye ba ngan pa/) danda: (dbyug pa/)...la gu da: aanda:...(sgo nga /
analyzed: (/ khro mo/)...tsanda:...(gtum mo/) durdzdza na ...(skye ba ngan pa/) danda: (dbyug pa/)...la gu da: aanda:...(sgo nga /
translated: Canda is for angry, durjjanā is for bad birth, dandā is for staff,

original: bya la sogs pa skye ba'i snod/)...paksha pra sa ba: banda: pags pa nas /
analyzed: bya la sogs pa skye ba'i snod/)...paksha pra sa ba: banda: pags pa nas /
translated: laghudandā is for egg, and pakṣaprasaṃvānandā is for the vessel of birth such as a bird, and so on.🔽 Vanda is for skin,🔽 and so on.🔽 Vanda is for skin,

original: du shtsarma: ganda: ka po la: khanda:...(dum bu/) gu na bi k'a ra: kunda la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: du shtsarma: ganda: ka po la: khanda:...(dum bu/) gu na bi k'a ra: kunda la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: duḥścaḥ, gāndhāraḥ, kapolāḥ, khaṇḍāḥ, guṇavikāraḥ, kuṇḍalāḥ, etc.

original: kunda la sogs pa'i sgra rnams da pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: kunda la sogs pa'i sgra rnams da pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: The words kuṇḍalāḥ, etc., should be treated as indeclinables.

original: ku na sgra la'o //
analyzed: ku na sgra la'o //
translated: The word kuṇa is for sound.

original: mu na so sor shes pa la'o //
analyzed: mu na so sor shes pa la'o //
translated: The word muṇa is for each one.

original: @90a * // dzu na 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: @90a * // dzu na 'gro ba la'o //
translated: The word juṇa is for going.

original: tu na myur ba la'o //
analyzed: tu na myur ba la'o //
translated: The word tuṇa is for quickly.

original: de la tshig phrad las aata aeng 'gegs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la tshig phrad las aata aeng 'gegs pa la'o //
translated: In that [case], from the indeclinables, aṭ is for negation.

original: kunda (nye bar sgrogs pa'i rdzas/)...bh'a dza nam mundam (mgo bo/)...shi ra: dzunda: ba nam tunda: mu kham kha gdong sgo de bzhin gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kunda (nye bar sgrogs pa'i rdzas/)...bh'a dza nam mundam (mgo bo/)...shi ra: dzunda: ba nam tunda: mu kham kha gdong sgo de bzhin gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Kuṇḍa, bhajānaṃ, muṇḍa, śiraḥ, juṇḍa, vanatunda, mukhaṃ, khaṃ, dvāraṃ, and so on should be seen in the same way.

original: sha mi las dha'o //
analyzed: sha mi las dha'o //
translated: From śami, dha.

original: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
translated: From śamuda, mu, pacification.

original: sha mi las dha 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha mi las dha 'gyur ro //
translated: From śamila, dha, it becomes.

original: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su nga ro sogs sngar bzhin no //
translated: The suffix and so on are as before.🔽From śaṇḍa, prasavaḥ, etc.

original: shanda: pra sa ba:...(ma ning ngo/) / sha ki las aunta'o //🔽sha kli nus pa la'o //
analyzed: shanda: pra sa ba:...(ma ning ngo/) / sha ki las aunta'o // sha kli nus pa la'o //

original: sha ki las aunta pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha ki las aunta pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From śakila, uṇ, it becomes the other side.

analyzed: sha kunta: (bya'o/).../ pakshi dzr'i bi sha dag las aanta tsa'o //

original: dzri lang tsho nyams pa la'o //
analyzed: dzri lang tsho nyams pa la'o //

original: bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //

original: 'di dag las aantatsa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las aantatsa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: aata aeng dang pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: aata aeng dang pha rol nyid do //
translated: The word ata means and the other side.

original: dza ranta ma hi kha:...(ma he 'o/) / yang ba mtha' nye'i'o zhes pas ae nyid do //
analyzed: dza ranta ma hi kha:...(ma he 'o/) / yang ba mtha' nye'i'o zhes pas ae nyid do //

original: be shanta: balla: ru hi nanti dz'i bi las shita'o //
analyzed: be shanta: balla: ru hi nanti dz'i bi las shita'o //

original: ru ha rab tu skye ba la'o //
analyzed: ru ha rab tu skye ba la'o //

original: du na di yang dag par 'phel ba la'o //
analyzed: du na di yang dag par 'phel ba la'o //

original: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams las aantats\ pha rol tu 'gyur ba shita bzhin no //

analyzed: yang ba mtha' nye'i'o zhes pas ao nyid do //
translated: The word anta is formed from the two words ruha and dīpana, meaning the other side.

original: ro hanta: briksha:...(shing/) shita las d'isha'o //
analyzed: ro hanta: briksha:...(shing/) shita las d'isha'o //

analyzed: d'i yig las a'i yig phyung nas nga yig d'i au d'a'i 'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //

analyzed: sha yig ng'i sha spyi bzung ba'i don no //

original: 'di rnams las aata tsa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las aata tsa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Of these, aṭa becomes para.

original: aata aeng pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: aata aeng pha rol nyid do //
translated: Aṭa becomes para itself.

original: bha ra ta nat darsha ta: so ma:...(zla ba/) aa ka'i aata aeng zhes pas ae nyid do //
analyzed: bha ra ta nat darsha ta: so ma:...(zla ba/) aa ka'i aata aeng zhes pas ae nyid do //

original: aay ru bsgyur ro //
analyzed: aay ru bsgyur ro //

original: dza ya ta: ba hr'i: parpa ta: (ri bo/)...gi ri: pa tsa te: s'u pa k'a ra: ya ma ta: (nad/)...byu dh'i na ma ta: nam hadya ta: yadznya: kha la ta: durdzdza na: pri shi ranydzi las ki ta'o //

original: pri shu bkru ba la'o //
analyzed: pri shu bkru ba la'o //
translated: Pṛṣu is for washing.

original: ranydza tshos la'o //
analyzed: ranydza tshos la'o //
translated: Nyaja is for dyeing.

original: 'di dag las aata tsa pha rol tu 'gyur ba kita bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag las aata tsa pha rol tu 'gyur ba kita bzhin no //

original: kita bzhin aata aeng med do //
analyzed: kita bzhin aata aeng med do //
translated: Like kitā, aṭa becomes without e.

original: kita la'o zhes pas ranydzi'i na yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: kita la'o zhes pas ranydzi'i na yig dbyi'o //
translated: Kitā is for nyaja. Thus the letter ya of nyaja is elided.

original: mring srog gtong ba la'o //
analyzed: mring srog gtong ba la'o //
translated: mriṅ for to kill.

original: gr'i nges par gnon pa la'o //
analyzed: gr'i nges par gnon pa la'o //

original: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
translated: śamuda for to be pacified.

original: l'u gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: l'u gcod pa la'o //
translated: lau for to cut.

original: s'u nya dag par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: s'u nya dag par byed pa la'o //
translated: sau for to purify.

original: dhurb'i 'tshe ba la'o //🔽'di rnams las tan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhurb'i 'tshe ba la'o // 'di rnams las tan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: dhura for to harm.🔽These are the roots.

original: aata aeng ra pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: aata aeng ra pha rol nyid do //
translated: ata for the other side.🔽marta for world.🔽garta for pit.🔽śabhra for wind.🔽hasta for hand.

original: marta:('jig rten/)...lo ka: gartta: (khung ngo/).../ sh'a bhra: bata: (rlung/)...b'a yu: hasta: ka ra:...(lag pa/) aik gi aata aeng zhes pas ae nyid do //
analyzed: marta:('jig rten/)...lo ka: gartta: (khung ngo/).../ sh'a bhra: bata: (rlung/)...b'a yu: hasta: ka ra:...(lag pa/) aik gi aata aeng zhes pas ae nyid do //
translated: eka for one.🔽eta for to be born.🔽hala for milk.

original: ae ta: barnna: ha la la ma'i 'o zhes pas rjes su nga ro'o //
analyzed: ae ta: barnna: ha la la ma'i 'o zhes pas rjes su nga ro'o //
translated: ya for to follow.

original: yay\ la rjes su nga ro'i yama\'o zhes pas ches nye ba'i na yig go //
analyzed: yay\ la rjes su nga ro'i yama\'o zhes pas ches nye ba'i na yig go //
translated: ya for to follow.🔽anta for end.🔽avasanta for end of the day.

original: aanta: (mtha'/)...aa ba s'a nam danta: da sha ni ai ka'i aata aeng zhes pas ao nyid do //
analyzed: aanta: (mtha'/)...aa ba s'a nam danta: da sha ni ai ka'i aata aeng zhes pas ao nyid do //
translated: dasani for ten.

original: lo ta: (mchi ma/)...aa shru p'a ta: po ta: b'a la: ra las dbyi'o zhes pas ba yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: lo ta: (mchi ma/)...aa shru p'a ta: po ta: b'a la: ra las dbyi'o zhes pas ba yig dbyi'o //
translated: The letter va is elided by the rule lo ta, etc., aśru pāta, pota, vāla, rāla.

original: byings kyi ra ba dag la aa tsa med pa la ai ka gi ring po'o //
analyzed: byings kyi ra ba dag la aa tsa med pa la ai ka gi ring po'o //
translated: In the case of the roots that do not have a final a, the i becomes a long i.

original: dh'urtta: sha tha: ghri @91b si d'u rnams las kta'o //
analyzed: dh'urtta: sha tha: ghri @91b si d'u rnams las kta'o //
translated: The letter ka is elided by the rule dhur ta, śa tha, ghri si du.

original: ghri 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: ghri 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: The letter ghri is changed to la.

original: shi 'ching ba la'o //
analyzed: shi 'ching ba la'o //
translated: The letter śa is binding.

original: shthi bu dang shvak ma yin pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sha yig gis yig go //
analyzed: shthi bu dang shvak ma yin pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sha yig gis yig go //
translated: The letter śa is elided by the rule śa, not śa, and śva, not śva, are elided at the beginning of a word, and the letter ya is elided by the rule ya, not ya, and ra, not ra, are elided at the beginning of a word.

original: d'u nga yongs su gdung ba la'o //
analyzed: d'u nga yongs su gdung ba la'o //
translated: The letter du means to be tormented.🔽 The letter ṅa is elided by the rule ṅa, not ṅa, and ta, not ta, are elided at the beginning of a word, and the letter ra is elided by the rule ra, not ra, and la, not la, are elided at the beginning of a word.🔽 The letter ka is elided by the rule ka, not ka, and ta, not ta, are elided at the beginning of a word.🔽 The letter kṣa is elided by the rule kṣa, not kṣa, and sa, not sa, are elided at the beginning of a word.🔽 The letter i is elided by the rule i, not i, and u, not u, are elided at the beginning of a word.

original: nga yig tang ldan pa las tal dang po las ra med pa las so zhes pa'i rtags don no //🔽'di rnams las kt'a 'gyur ro //🔽ka yig krinya la'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
analyzed: nga yig tang ldan pa las tal dang po las ra med pa las so zhes pa'i rtags don no // 'di rnams las kt'a 'gyur ro // ka yig krinya la'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
translated: The letter a is elided by the rule a, not a, and o, not o, are elided at the beginning of a word.🔽 The letter ya is elided by the rule ya, not ya, and ra, not ra, are elided at the beginning of a word.🔽 The letter ṅa is elided by the rule ṅa, not ṅa, and ta, not ta, are elided at the beginning of a word.

original: de yis aik gi aat aeng bya ba'i don la zhes pas aat aeng du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yis aik gi aat aeng bya ba'i don la zhes pas aat aeng du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter a is elided by the rule a, not a, and o, not o, are elided at

original: ghri tam m'ardzya ...(mar//) si tam shuklam ...(dkar po/) d'u ta:...(pho nya/) breshya: t'a ta pa yi ta dzartte  s'u ra ta rnams so //
analyzed: ghri tam m'ardzya ...(mar//) si tam shuklam ...(dkar po/) d'u ta:...(pho nya/) breshya: t'a ta pa yi ta dzartte  s'u ra ta rnams so //
translated: grītaṃ mārdhyam, sitaṃ śuklam, dūtaḥ, preṣyaḥ, bṛśyaḥ, tātaḥ, pāyitaḥ, jarattaḥ, sūrataḥ.

original: sgra 'di rnams kta'i mtha' tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: sgra 'di rnams kta'i mtha' tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: These words should be joined with the final particle of the kṛt affixes.

original: ta nu rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: ta nu rgyas pa la'o //
translated: Taṇu is for expansion.

original: pa tli ba the lam la 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: pa tli ba the lam la 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Paṭli is for going on a path.

original: dzan skyed par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: dzan skyed par byed pa la'o //
translated: Jan is for producing.

original: ra mu rtse ba la'o //
analyzed: ra mu rtse ba la'o //
translated: Ra is for playing.

original: su sngon du'o //
analyzed: su sngon du'o //
translated: Su is for before.

original: de la ta na'i ring po nyid dang / na dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: de la ta na'i ring po nyid dang / na dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: There, the long form of taṇu and the nasalization of na are also.

original: t'a ta:...(pa/) pi t'a pa ti'i la nyid dang / ait la dag go /
analyzed: t'a ta:...(pa/) pi t'a pa ti'i la nyid dang / ait la dag go /
translated: Tātaḥ, pitā, pāti, and so on are for self.

original: (/ skra dkar/)...sa li ta: ke sha bi k'a ra:...(sgra'i rnam 'gyur/) dza ni'i mtha' re phar bsgyur ro //
analyzed: (/ skra dkar/)...sa li ta: ke sha bi k'a ra:...(sgra'i rnam 'gyur/) dza ni'i mtha' re phar bsgyur ro //
translated: Śalitā, keśavikāra, and so on are for the end of janī, changing the final -i to -e.

original: dzartta: dirgha ro ma tha: ra mi'i ma yig dbyi su'i ring po'o //
analyzed: dzartta: dirgha ro ma tha: ra mi'i ma yig dbyi su'i ring po'o //
translated: Jarattaḥ, dirgharoma, and so on are for the long form of rami, changing the final -i to -e.

original: s'u ra ta: su kha sam p'a sa: sha ma la sogs pa rnams las aa tha'o //
analyzed: s'u ra ta: su kha sam p'a sa: sha ma la sogs pa rnams las aa tha'o //
translated: Sūrataḥ, sukhasampātaḥ, śamala, and so on are for the final -a.

original: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: sha mu da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
translated: Śam is for pacification.

original: sha pa spyo ba la'o //
analyzed: sha pa spyo ba la'o //
translated: shapa, to be despised.

original: da sa nges par gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: da sa nges par gnas pa la'o //
translated: dasa, to be fixed.

original: a'ad sngon du'o //
analyzed: a'ad sngon du'o //
translated: ada, before.

original: da yig a'ad ma da'i 'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
analyzed: da yig a'ad ma da'i 'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
translated: day, to be marked.

original: ba da brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: ba da brjod pa la'o //
translated: vada, to be spoken.

original: ru sgra la'o //
analyzed: ru sgra la'o //
translated: ru, sound.

original: gamli sri pli 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: gamli sri pli 'gro ba la'o //
translated: gamlipli, to go.

original: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: jīva, to hold life.

original: aa na shva sa srog la'o //
analyzed: aa na shva sa srog la'o //
translated: aśvasa, life.

original: pra sngon du'o //
analyzed: pra sngon du'o //
translated: pra, before.

original: du bhrinya 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: du bhrinya 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: dhrīṇi, to hold.

original: bi da shes pa la'o //
analyzed: bi da shes pa la'o //
translated: vid, to know.

original: 'di rnams las aa tha pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las aa tha pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, atha becomes parā.

original: sha ma tha: sa m'a dh'i: sha pa tha: pra tya ya k'a ra: aa ba sa tha: gri ham ba da tha: ko ki la: ra ba tha: (de nyid/)...sa ae ba: ga ma tha: k'a la: dz'i ba tha: dharm'a: aa na'i mtha' la yang ngo zhes pas na
analyzed: sha ma tha: sa m'a dh'i: sha pa tha: pra tya ya k'a ra: aa ba sa tha: gri ham ba da tha: ko ki la: ra ba tha: (de nyid/)...sa ae ba: ga ma tha: k'a la: dz'i ba tha: dharm'a: aa na'i mtha' la yang ngo zhes pas na
translated: śamathaḥ, samādhiḥ, śapathaḥ, pratya-yakāraḥ, avasthā, gṛhaṃ, vadhā, tha, ko kila, rabhatha, sa eva, gama, tha, kāla, jīva, dharma, aṇī, and anta.

original: nyid do // aak gi aak la ring po'o zhes pas pra'i sgra las aa yig dang / aan gyi aa yig gi lhan cig gnyis dag gi gcig aak gi ring po nyid do//
analyzed: nyid do // aak gi aak la ring po'o zhes pas pra'i sgra las aa yig dang / aan gyi aa yig gi lhan cig gnyis dag gi gcig aak gi ring po nyid do//
translated: The long vowel of the a in ak is from the word ak.

original: @92a * // pr'a na tha: pra dz'a pa ti: bha ra tha: aagni: yang ba mtha' nye'i zhes pas ae nyid do //
analyzed: @92a * // pr'a na tha: pra dz'a pa ti: bha ra tha: aagni: yang ba mtha' nye'i zhes pas ae nyid do //
translated: The e is from the word paranta and praja pati and bhārata and agni and yava and anta.

original: be da tha: (lam/)...margha: ra mi ku shi k'a shi rnams las ktha na'o //
analyzed: be da tha: (lam/)...margha: ra mi ku shi k'a shi rnams las ktha na'o //
translated: The tha is from the words veda and marga and ramakushaka and kasika.

original: ra mu rtse ba la'o //🔽ku sha nges par 'gugs pa la'o //
analyzed: ra mu rtse ba la'o // ku sha nges par 'gugs pa la'o //
translated: The ra is from the word ramurasta.🔽The kusha is from the word kusha.

original: k'a shi gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: k'a shi gsal ba la'o //
translated: The ka is from the word kasika.

original: 'di rnams las kthan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las kthan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, kata becomes para.

original: ka yig kitala'o  zhes pa'i aata aeng 'gegs pa'i don no //🔽na yig dbyangs kyi don no //
analyzed: ka yig kitala'o  zhes pa'i aata aeng 'gegs pa'i don no // na yig dbyangs kyi don no //
translated: The a is from the word akita and means to block.

original: kita la'o zhes pas ma dbyi'o //
analyzed: kita la'o zhes pas ma dbyi'o //
translated: The na is from the word svara and means sound.🔽The ta is from the word kita.

original: ra tha: (shing rta'o/).../ syanda ni stu'i shtsu dang shtu dag las de dag go zhes pas tha yig gi tha yig go /
analyzed: ra tha: (shing rta'o/).../ syanda ni stu'i shtsu dang shtu dag las de dag go zhes pas tha yig gi tha yig go /
translated: The tha is from the words syanda and sthu and sthu.

original: (/ mdze/)...kushtha: (nad/)...by'a dhe: brashtsa sogs mdo yis sha nyid do //
analyzed: (/ mdze/)...kushtha: (nad/)...by'a dhe: brashtsa sogs mdo yis sha nyid do //

original: gong bzhin tha yig gi tha yig go //
analyzed: gong bzhin tha yig gi tha yig go //
translated: The letter tha is the letter tha as before.🔽

original: k'ashtham aindha nam ...(bud shing/) aa ba las bhrinya las so //
analyzed: k'ashtham aindha nam ...(bud shing/) aa ba las bhrinya las so //
translated: kāṣṭhā, indhana,🔽āvā, bhrājiṣṇu.

original: du bhri nya 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: du bhri nya 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: The one who catches the fish is Dhupa.🔽

original: aa ba sngon du'o //
analyzed: aa ba sngon du'o //
translated: The avagraha is placed before.🔽

original: 'di las kthan 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las kthan 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not possible to go beyond this.🔽

original: aa pa bhri tha: yadznya ba s'a nam ...(mchod spyin gyi mtha'/) au shi ku shi g'a aarti rnams las tha na'o //
analyzed: aa pa bhri tha: yadznya ba s'a nam ...(mchod spyin gyi mtha'/) au shi ku shi g'a aarti rnams las tha na'o //
translated: apāvarta,  yajñavāstu,  uśīka,  kuśīlava,  gārti,  and tāna. )🔽

original: au sha bsreg pa la'o //
analyzed: au sha bsreg pa la'o //
translated: uṣa means to burn.🔽

original: dbyangs don no //
analyzed: dbyangs don no //
translated: The melody is the meaning.🔽

original: dz'a gri bi: (rgyal po/)...r'a dz'a tsha bi la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dz'a gri bi: (rgyal po/)...r'a dz'a tsha bi la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: and the king Jagravi,🔽and the king Rajavahana, and so on.

original: tsha bi nga stha ping shi  ki di ba d'i di pi kri pi brishbi dz'i bi n'i bi sgra 'di rnams kvin pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: tsha bi nga stha ping shi  ki di ba d'i di pi kri pi brishbi dz'i bi n'i bi sgra 'di rnams kvin pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: The words tsha, bi, ṅa, stha, piṅ, śi, ki, di, va, dā, di, pi, kṛi, pi, bṛi, śva, jī, vi, and ṇī are to be used as final particles.

original: tsha da sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: tsha da sgrib pa la'o //
translated: The second is the obscuration of the afflictions.🔽

original: shtha 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
analyzed: shtha 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
translated: Stha is used for to go and to stop.🔽🔽

original: shthi bu dang shv'ak min pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sa'o //
analyzed: shthi bu dang shv'ak min pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sa'o //
translated: The first of the syllables that are not ŚAT and VṚK is SA.

original: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi 'ang med do zhes pas tha yig gi tha yig go //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi 'ang med do zhes pas tha yig gi tha yig go //
translated: The letter THA is the letter THA, because there is no reason without a reason.

original: ka ki g-yo ba la'o //
analyzed: ka ki g-yo ba la'o //
translated: KA and KI are for movement.

original: ai yig ai dita kyi nu ma'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
analyzed: ai yig ai dita kyi nu ma'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //
translated: The letter I is the breast of Iḍā.

original: 'di nyid kyis numa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis numa'o //
translated: This very [letter] is the breast.

original: au yig ma yig dag sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: au yig ma yig dag sngar bzhin no //
translated: The letters U and MA are as before.

original: di bu rtse ba la'o //
analyzed: di bu rtse ba la'o //
translated: DI is for playing.

original: du kri nya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du kri nya byed pa la'o //
translated: DUKRĪ is for making.

original: pri shu bkru ba la'o //
analyzed: pri shu bkru ba la'o //
translated: PRIKṢU is for washing.

original: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: JĪVĀ is for holding life.

original: n'i thob pa la'o //
analyzed: n'i thob pa la'o //
translated: NĪ is for obtaining.

original: na'i na'o zhes pas na nyid do //
analyzed: na'i na'o zhes pas na nyid do //
translated: NĪ is the letter NA.

original: 'di rnams las kvin pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las kvin pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: From these, KAVIN is the word for the other side.

original: rjes 'brel dbye ba sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes 'brel dbye ba sngar bzhin no //
translated: The division of the suffix is as before.

original: tsha di'i da yig gi dbyi'o //
analyzed: tsha di'i da yig gi dbyi'o //
translated: The syllable of the letter DA of this [word] is DA.

original: tsha bi: tra ka: tishtha ti'i thung du nyid do //
analyzed: tsha bi: tra ka: tishtha ti'i thung du nyid do //
translated: TSAVĪ is for TRĀK, and TIṢṬHA is for the short TĪ.

original: stha bi: tantra b'a ya: ka ka'i na yig gi dbyi'o //
analyzed: stha bi: tantra b'a ya: ka ka'i na yig gi dbyi'o //
translated: S THAVĪ is for TANTRAVĀYA, and KA is for the syllable of the letter ṆA.

original: ka yig las aa yig gi @92b ai nyid do //
analyzed: ka yig las aa yig gi @92b ai nyid do //
translated: From the letter KA, the letter A is the letter I.

original: bi yig las ai yig bzung nas ba yig dbyi ba tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: bi yig las ai yig bzung nas ba yig dbyi ba tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: Having taken the vowel i from the letter vi, the letter ba is elided.🔽kiki

original: ki ki (bya/)...paksh'i: di bi'i ba yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: ki ki (bya/)...paksh'i: di bi'i ba yig dbyi'o //
translated: pakshi🔽The letter di is elided from the root divi.

original: di bi y'a di dya ...(nyi ma/) byings de nyid kyi gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: di bi y'a di dya ...(nyi ma/) byings de nyid kyi gnyis nyid do //
translated: dibadi

original: di ba di ba'i hal dang po ma yin pa'i zhes pas ba yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: di ba di ba'i hal dang po ma yin pa'i zhes pas ba yig dbyi'o //
translated: The first letter ha is elided.

original: ring po nyid dang ba yig dbyi ba'ang pha rol gyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ring po nyid dang ba yig dbyi ba'ang pha rol gyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The lengthening and the elision of the letter ba are also the accomplishment of the other.🔽dai🔽divi🔽sarga🔽krivi

original: d'i di bi: sarga: kri bi: dhu pa: pra shvi: (chu/)...dzal: dz'i bi'i ba yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: d'i di bi: sarga: kri bi: dhu pa: pra shvi: (chu/)...dzal: dz'i bi'i ba yig dbyi'o //
translated: dhupa🔽prashavi🔽jal🔽javi🔽The letter ba is elided.

original: dz'i bi: (sman/)...ao sha dhi: n'i bi: pr'apti: bri ba si dag las ktina'o //
analyzed: dz'i bi: (sman/)...ao sha dhi: n'i bi: pr'apti: bri ba si dag las ktina'o //
translated: javi🔽oshadhi

original: dri nga ma gus pa la'o //
analyzed: dri nga ma gus pa la'o //
translated: nabi🔽prati🔽dri🔽pas

original: pa sa kun tu sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: pa sa kun tu sgrib pa la'o //
translated: sarana

original: 'di dag las ktin pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las ktin pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, ktin becomes the other.

original: ka yig aata aeng 'gegs pa'i don no //
analyzed: ka yig aata aeng 'gegs pa'i don no //
translated: The letter ka is the meaning of at and ang.

original: na yig dbyangs don /
analyzed: na yig dbyangs don /
translated: The letter na is the meaning of vowel.🔽driti🔽carma

original: dri ti: (pags pa/)...tsarma: bsti m'u dr'a sh'a yam p'a ti las da ti'o //
analyzed: dri ti: (pags pa/)...tsarma: bsti m'u dr'a sh'a yam p'a ti las da ti'o //
translated: bhastimudrashayam

original: p'a bsrung pa la'o //
analyzed: p'a bsrung pa la'o //
translated: The root pā means to protect.

original: p'a ti las da ti pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: p'a ti las da ti pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The root pā becomes para in the past tense.

original: da yig las aa yig phyung nas da yig dit la zhes pa'i rtags don no //
analyzed: da yig las aa yig phyung nas da yig dit la zhes pa'i rtags don no //
translated: The letter da is extracted from the letter da, and the letter da is the meaning of the sign.

original: de yis di ta la: zhes a'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: de yis di ta la: zhes a'a dbyi'o //
translated: By that, dita is the vowel ā.

original: pa ti: (dbang phyug).../ sv'a m'i /🔽aa mi las aata'o //
analyzed: pa ti: (dbang phyug).../ sv'a m'i / aa mi las aata'o //

analyzed: tsi ta bzhin no // ba ha ti: goo: ba sa ti: gr'a ma sanni pe sha: tanti las a'i'o //

original: tandra zhes pa mdo'i byings /
analyzed: tandra zhes pa mdo'i byings /

analyzed: aa yig brjod don no //

analyzed: lakshi las mut yang ngo //

analyzed: laksha mthong ba la'o //

original: 'di las a'i pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las a'i pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mat yang ngo zhes pas mut yang ngo //

original: au yig brjod don no //
analyzed: au yig brjod don no //

original: ta yig shtit bya ba'i don no /
analyzed: ta yig shtit bya ba'i don no /
translated: The syllable ta is the meaning of ta.🔽 The syllable la is la.🔽 The syllable śrī is śrī.🔽 The syllable a is a.

original: p'a bsrung pa la'o //
analyzed: p'a bsrung pa la'o //

original: m'a tshad ma'o //
analyzed: m'a tshad ma'o //

analyzed: aa b'i pra k'a sha: ai ka'i aata aeng zhes pas aa nyid do //

analyzed: ta r'i bee shva na r'a: sta r'i ra (bdug spos/)...dh'u pa: y'a p'a zhes pa 'di dag gi gnyis nyid do //

analyzed: thung du nyid dang a'a yig dbyi ba'ang tshig phrad du bya'o //

original: r'a l'a len pa la'o //

original: 'di las dee pha rol tu 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'di las dee pha rol tu 'gyur ro ;

analyzed: /dee yig las aee yig bzung nas da yig dita la zhes pa'i rtags don no //

analyzed: dita la zhes pas mtha'i aa tsa sogs dbyi'o // ree su su'i au yig su'i 'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //

analyzed: ree'i ha la'o zhes pas aee yig gi a'a yig go //

analyzed: do yig las ao yig phyung nas da yig dit la'o zhes pa'i rtags don no //

analyzed: mtha'i aatsa sogs zhes pas ma yig aa yig dag gi dbyi'o // go su su'i su yig su'i zhes pa'i rtags don no //

original: a'u na:bika la: (nag po/)...krishna (kha dog/)...parnna: d'apa'o //
analyzed: a'u na:bika la: (nag po/)...krishna (kha dog/)...parnna: d'apa'o //

original: trisht'a aa bhi l'a sa: bud dhu: bo ddhi ratna dza too ya du ta krishnam m'a sv'a sla g'a: pi ba h'a ka d'a dha rnams kyi tal la'o zhes pas a'i nyid do //
analyzed: trisht'a aa bhi l'a sa: bud dhu: bo ddhi ratna dza too ya du ta krishnam m'a sv'a sla g'a: pi ba h'a ka d'a dha rnams kyi tal la'o zhes pas a'i nyid do //
translated: Trishtā abhilāṣaḥ, buddhuḥ, bodhir ratna-jato yadu-ta-kṛṣṇamāsva-sva-slagāḥ, piva-hā ka-dādhara-nāṃ tvaṃ lāva iti aiḥ.

original: dh'i ni ra sa mu dra:...(rgya mtsho'o/) / ma nu byung las auta'o zhes pas au nyid do //
analyzed: dh'i ni ra sa mu dra:...(rgya mtsho'o/) / ma nu byung las auta'o zhes pas au nyid do //

original: ra pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: ra pha rol nyid do //
translated: Raḥ paratra eva.

original: byings kyi ra ba dag la aitsa med pa la ai ka gi ring po nyid do /
analyzed: byings kyi ra ba dag la aitsa med pa la ai ka gi ring po nyid do /
translated: In the roots, where there is no iṭ, there is the lengthening of i and ka.🔽 Pūrṇaḥ, sa eva.

original: (/ gang ba/)...purnna: (de nyid do/).../ sa aa pa'i krita las su ka'ang ngo //
analyzed: (/ gang ba/)...purnna: (de nyid do/).../ sa aa pa'i krita las su ka'ang ngo //

original: kri tr'i gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: kri tr'i gcod pa la'o //
translated: Kṛtiḥ chedane.

original: kri t'i las nag pha rol tu 'gyur zhing suka'ang ngo //
analyzed: kri t'i las nag pha rol tu 'gyur zhing suka'ang ngo //

original: ka yig kit bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: ka yig kit bya ba'i don no //
translated: Kaḥ, kṛti-kriyā-arthaḥ.

original: de yis kit la'o zhes pas aat aeng 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: de yis kit la'o zhes pas aat aeng 'gegs pa'o //

analyzed: krit+snam ni ra wa she shom / sh'i shi'i ait kyi aat 'ang ngo //

original: shli sha 'khyud pa la'o //
analyzed: shli sha 'khyud pa la'o //

original: 'di las nak pha rol tu 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di las nak pha rol tu 'gyur zhing /

original: ai yig gi ai nyid do //
analyzed: ai yig gi ai nyid do //

original: na nyid kyang ngo //🔽t'ikshna: ni sh'a ni /
analyzed: na nyid kyang ngo // t'ikshna: ni sh'a ni /

original: shthi bu dang shvak ma yin pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sa nyid do //
analyzed: shthi bu dang shvak ma yin pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa'o zhes pas sa nyid do //
translated: The first syllable of the word flesh (māṃsa) is the earth element.

original: shit ma yin pa aetsa'i a'a nyid do //
analyzed: shit ma yin pa aetsa'i a'a nyid do //
translated: The vowel of the letter A is not the vowel of the letter I.

original: shtha: 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
analyzed: shtha: 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
translated: The word sthā means to stop.

original: p'i 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: p'i 'gro ba la'o //
translated: The word gati means to go.

original: tri sha sgom pa la'o //
analyzed: tri sha sgom pa la'o //
translated: The word triśa means to meditate.

original: ri 'gro @97a * //
analyzed: ri 'gro @97a * //
translated: The word ri means to go.

original: ba la'o // dz'i lang tsho nyams pa la'o //
analyzed: ba la'o // dz'i lang tsho nyams pa la'o //
translated: The word jī means to lose youth.🔽 The word rā'' means to be sick, and the word auṣadha means medicine.

original: d'apa'o // r'asn'a ao sha dhi ...(sman/) p'asna go gr'i b'a tishtha ti'i a'a yig gi a'u yig go //
analyzed: d'apa'o // r'asn'a ao sha dhi ...(sman/) p'asna go gr'i b'a tishtha ti'i a'a yig gi a'u yig go //
translated: The word pā'' means to stand, and the vowel of the letter A is the vowel of the letter U.

original: sa yig dbyi ba dang na nyid tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: sa yig dbyi ba dang na nyid tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: The letter S is elided, and the word na is used as a conjunction.🔽 The word sthūna means pillar, and the word bhāṇḍa means special musical instrument.

original: sthu n'a gri ha bha ra n'i b'i d'a b'a dya bi shesha: (rol mo'i khyad par/) tri shi'i sha yig dbyi ba tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: sthu n'a gri ha bha ra n'i b'i d'a b'a dya bi shesha: (rol mo'i khyad par/) tri shi'i sha yig dbyi ba tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: The letter S of the word triśī is elided, and the word is used as a conjunction.

original: tri nam ba ra n'a di aarta'i aat aang  dang ra pha rol dang na nyid do //
analyzed: tri nam ba ra n'a di aarta'i aat aang  dang ra pha rol dang na nyid do //
translated: The word tri means three, and the word varṇā means colors.🔽 The word arṇā means old, and the word vitapam means arṇā.

original: aarnna: bi ta pam dz'arnn'i (rgan po/)...briddha: de bzhin du gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: aarnna: bi ta pam dz'arnn'i (rgan po/)...briddha: de bzhin du gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word brīḍi means to grow, and the other words should be understood in the same way.

original: kri bri tr'i ya mi d'a ri aardzi las aun na'o //🔽rum ba krinya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: kri bri tr'i ya mi d'a ri aardzi las aun na'o // rum ba krinya byed pa la'o //
translated: kṛtrima, artificial; yāminī, night; ardhi, to be ashamed; unna, to rise.

original: brinya sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: brinya sgrib pa la'o //
translated: rum, to be covered; kṛtya, to be done.

original: tr'i rkyal ba la'o //
analyzed: tr'i rkyal ba la'o //
translated: dri, to be hidden; trī, to cross.

original: ya mu nye bar 'jig pa la'o //
analyzed: ya mu nye bar 'jig pa la'o //
translated: yāminī, night; yā, to destroy.

original: dri rnam par 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: dri rnam par 'joms pa la'o //
translated: dri, to be destroyed; ṛ, to be covered.

original: sbyor ba po'i bya ba la'o zhes pas nitsa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba po'i bya ba la'o zhes pas nitsa'o //

original: aatsa 'i'o zhes pas a'a nyid do //🔽rik gi aan las ral dag go zhes pas ra pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: aatsa 'i'o zhes pas a'a nyid do // rik gi aan las ral dag go zhes pas ra pha rol nyid do //

original: aardza sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: aardza sgrub pa la'o //
translated: ardhi, to be ashamed; ardha, half.

original: 'di rnams las aun na pha rol tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di rnams las aun na pha rol tu 'gyur /

original: aik gi aat aeng 'o //🔽ra pha rol nyid do //
analyzed: aik gi aat aeng 'o // ra pha rol nyid do //
translated: ika, to be; aṅ, to be.🔽ṛ, to be; ṛ, to be.

original: ra sha las zhes pa las na nyid do //
analyzed: ra sha las zhes pa las na nyid do //
translated: śa, to be; na, to be.

original: d'apa'o // ka ru na ...(snying rje/) kri p'a ba ru na: dza la r'a dz'a ...(chu bdag) / ta ru na: au b'a ka pi ri ka la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas la nyid do //
analyzed: d'apa'o // ka ru na ...(snying rje/) kri p'a ba ru na: dza la r'a dz'a ...(chu bdag) / ta ru na: au b'a ka pi ri ka la sogs pa rnams so zhes pas la nyid do //
translated: dā, to give; ka, to be; ruṇa, to be compassionate; kṛpā, compassion; avāruṇa, water lord; taruṇa, young; ubā, to be; akapiraka, and so on.

original: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi'ang med do zhes pas na yig gi na yig go //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi'ang med do zhes pas na yig gi na yig go //
translated: Since there is no reason without a reasoner, there is the na of the ya.

analyzed: ta lun: (de nyid do/).../ sa ae ba d'apa'o // ya mu n'a: (chu klung/)...na b'i n'i ait ma yin pa la'o zhes pas ni dbyi'o //

original: parba: gri ha p'a ba dza hv'am ...(sdig pa/) talpa sha ya na stu'i a'u yang ngo //
analyzed: parba: gri ha p'a ba dza hv'am ...(sdig pa/) talpa sha ya na stu'i a'u yang ngo //
translated: Parva, Grihapati, Vajra, and so on.

original: shtu bstod pa la'o //
analyzed: shtu bstod pa la'o //
translated: Sthiti is for praise.🔽Sthi, pu, and sva are the first of the sa group.

original: shthi bu dang shvak min pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa nyid do zhes pas sha yig gi sa yig go //
analyzed: shthi bu dang shvak min pa'i dang po'i sha'i sa nyid do zhes pas sha yig gi sa yig go //
translated: Ta is for the ta group.

original: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi'ang med do zhes pas ta yig gi ta yig go ;🔽/'di las pa pha rol tu 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can gyi'ang med do zhes pas ta yig gi ta yig go ; /'di las pa pha rol tu 'gyur zhing /
translated: Without a reason, there is no one with a reason.

original: au yig gi a'u yig go //
analyzed: au yig gi a'u yig go //
translated: U is for ū.

original: stu bo ...(mchod rten/)...tsee tyam /
analyzed: stu bo ...(mchod rten/)...tsee tyam /
translated: Stu is for caitya.

original: yu ku su rnams kyi kit 'ang ngo //
analyzed: yu ku su rnams kyi kit 'ang ngo //
translated: Yu, ku, and su are for kit also.

original: yu spel  ba la'o //
analyzed: yu spel  ba la'o //
translated: Yu is for increase.

original: ku sgra la'o //
analyzed: ku sgra la'o //
translated: Ku is for sound.

original: bu nya mngon par skye ba la'o //
analyzed: bu nya mngon par skye ba la'o //
translated: Bu is for manifest arising.

original: 'di rnams las gong bzhin pa pha rol tu 'gyur zhing au yig gi a'u yig go //
analyzed: 'di rnams las gong bzhin pa pha rol tu 'gyur zhing au yig gi a'u yig go //
translated: From these, as before, pa becomes para, and u becomes ū.

original: yu ba: badzny'a yashthi: k'u ba: (khron bya/) bra hi s'a ba: byanydza nam p'ashba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yu ba: badzny'a yashthi: k'u ba: (khron bya/) bra hi s'a ba: byanydza nam p'ashba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Yu is for vajra, ku is for kumbha, and su is for brahma, jñāna, paśu, and so on.

original: b'ashba sh'ashba shalbi ru ba sh'urppa khashpa zhes pa'i sgra 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams pa pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
analyzed: b'ashba sh'ashba shalbi ru ba sh'urppa khashpa zhes pa'i sgra 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams pa pha rol tshig phrad du bya'o //
translated: The following are examples of the class of words that end in a suffix:

original: b'a bri sgra la'o //🔽shu sha skyems pa la'o //
analyzed: b'a bri sgra la'o // shu sha skyems pa la'o //
translated: The word bā is for sound.🔽Śuśa is for thirst.

original: sha la 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: sha la 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Śalā is for going.

original: ru sgra la'o //🔽shr'i 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: ru sgra la'o // shr'i 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Ru is for sound.🔽Śrī is for harm.

original: ba nu nges par 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: ba nu nges par 'joms pa la'o //
translated: Vana is for destroying.
